body:
Please don't expose the _v2 op directly. We need to register both kernels, but then only expose a single python op, which only generates the _v2 op. To do that, you currently have to mark both the v1 and v2 ops "hidden" in the BUILD file, and then write a python wrapper which calls the generated_image_ops._..._v2() directly (ignoring the linter that will complain about a protected symbol access).

We're working on improving this workflow but that's what it is for now.

body_text:
Please don't expose the _v2 op directly. We need to register both kernels, but then only expose a single python op, which only generates the v2 op. To do that, you currently have to mark both the v1 and v2 ops "hidden" in the BUILD file, and then write a python wrapper which calls the generated_image_ops...._v2() directly (ignoring the linter that will complain about a protected symbol access).
We're working on improving this workflow but that's what it is for now.
